subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any tools for Test Case generation?
msgSnippet: I would like to add there must be some tool to generate atleast skeleton of testcases To point Axis does generate JUnit TestCase skeleton for WebService
messageBody:
I would like to add there must be some tool to generate atleast skeleton
of testcases
To point Axis does generate JUnit TestCase skeleton for WebService testing.


Dave Astels wrote:

> --- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "J. B. Rainsberger" <jbrains@r...> wrote:
> > >So said hehaifengcn on 2003-06-10 --------------------
> > >I have a project in which I want to some tools that can
> > > automatically generate test case to exercise given execution path.
>
> > The idea of automatically generating tests is incompatible with the
> > JUnit (and xUnit) philosophy. JUnit is a framework in which humans
> > write tests; it is not a tool that writes tests.
>
> Well said. I'll go farther and say that even a tool that generates a
> set of JUnit (or xUnit) stubs to test all (or some selected subset)
> the methods of a given class is incompatible with the philosophy.
> JUnit is used to test behaviour. Behaviours and methods and not 1-1
> or onto. A single behavior may encompass functionallity from several
> methods, and a single method may embody several behaviours. Hmm..
> there's an article in there.
>
> > An interesting question for you: how do you expect any program to
> > know the expected result for each code path? The key point of tests
> > is to compare an expected result to the actual result. How is it
> > possible for a non-human to know the expected result?
>
> Again, well said. I'm glad you're on our side.
>
> Dave
>
